title: Introduction to Software Engineering
subject: Software Engineering
theory:
**Software Engineering** is the systematic application of engineering approaches to the development of software. 
It is not just coding. It encompasses the entire lifecycle: Requirements, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, and Maintenance. 
Goal: High quality software, on time, within budget.

examples.code:
Coding = Writing checks.
Engineering = Designing the banking system structure, security, and scalability.

common_mistakes.correction: Programming is a phase of SE. SE is the whole process.

interview_questions.question: Define Software Engineering (IEEE).
interview_questions.answer: The application of a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach to the development, operation, and maintenance of software.
